title: Basics of Herbal Medicine
headline: Explore the tools and techniques used for making and administering herbal medicines in this free online course.
description: Do you want to learn how to set up a herbal pharmacy using tools and plants already found around your home? This course will teach you how to tap into the power of herbs to treat common illnesses. We will examine the unique properties of some 30 different herbs and the ailments they cure. You will also learn to make tinctures, medicinal oils, salves, pills and much more. Harness the healing power of herbs and improve your wellbeing. Enrol today!
courseDescription:
Medicinal herbs are recognised as the oldest system of healing on the planet. Herbal medicine traces its roots back to the earliest civilizations and continues to flourish as a popular healing art. According to the World Health Organisation, 80% of the world’s population used some form of traditional herbal medicine in 2008 and its rate of affordability, availability and accessibility is surging. In this course, Amer Taha, a medical health expert with years of experience, guides you on your journey to using herbal medicine for your wellbeing and that of your family members, friends or patients.

If you use herbs in cooking, you have already taken the first step in using herbal medicine. Our common culinary herbs and spices are among our most important and esteemed herbal medications. You are also considered to be 'practising' herbal medicine if you garden while tucking herbs here and there for added scent and beauty. This course will illustrate their overall benefit. We will discuss how to start a home garden and set up your ‘kitchen pharmacy’. You will learn the different processes used to convert garden herbs into medicines. These techniques include making infusions, decoctions, syrups, medicinal oils, salves, tinctures and pills. Further on, we will examine the science behind determining the dosage and duration of herbal treatments.

You will examine some thirty different herbs, analysing their unique properties. Gain a clear understanding of how to use them for various treatments. The course intends to help you start using herbs to enhance your health and wellbeing, reintroducing the traditional home health care practice for common everyday illnesses but not replacing the guidance of trained healthcare professionals. If you are interested in learning traditional herbal medicine at home or are a health practitioner interested in extending these treatments to your clients, you have come to the right place. Sign up for this free online course and discover how easily you can start incorporating herbs into your everyday life.
